ayas.translation: Nun. By the Pen and the (Record) which (men) write,-
ayas.transliteration: nūn ۚ wal qalami wa mā yasṭurūn

ayas.translation: Thou art not, by the Grace of thy Lord, mad or possessed.
Nay, verily for thee is a Reward unfailing:
ayas.transliteration: wa inna laka la-ajran ghayra mamnūn

ayas.translation: And thou (standest) on an exalted standard of character.
Soon wilt thou see, and they will see,
Which of you is afflicted with madness.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
ayas.translation: Verily it is thy Lord that knoweth best, which (among men) hath strayed from His Path: and He knoweth best those who receive (true) Guidance.
ayas.transliteration: inna rabbaka huwa a`lamu biman ḍalla `an sabīlihi wahuwa a`lamu bil muhtadīn

ayas.translation: So hearken not to those who deny (the Truth).
Their desire is that thou shouldst be pliant: so would they be pliant.
Heed not the type of despicable men,- ready with oaths,
A slanderer, going about with calumnies,
(Habitually) hindering (all) good, transgressing beyond bounds, deep in sin,
Violent (and cruel),- with all that, base-born,-
Because he possesses wealth and (numerous) sons.

ayas.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayas.translation: When to him are rehearsed Our Signs, "Tales of the ancients", he cries!
Soon shall We brand (the beast) on the snout!

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
ayas.translation: Verily We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden, when they resolved to gather the fruits of the (garden) in the morning.
ayas.transliteration: innā balawnāhum kamā balawnā aṣ-ḥābal jannati idh aqsamū layaṣrimunnahā muṣbiḥīn

ayas.translation: But made no reservation, ("If it be Allah's Will").

ayas.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Then there came on the (garden) a visitation from thy Lord, (which swept away) all around, while they were asleep.
ayas.transliteration: faṭāfa `alayhā ṭā-ifun min rabbika wahum nā-imūn

ayas.translation: So the (garden) became, by the morning, like a dark and desolate spot, (whose fruit had been gathered).
As the morning broke, they called out, one to another,-

ayas.arabic: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
ayas.translation: "Go ye to your tilth (betimes) in the morning, if ye would gather the fruits."
So they departed, conversing in secret low tones, (saying)-

ayas.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
ayas.translation: "Let not a single indigent person break in upon you into the (garden) this day."
And they opened the morning, strong in an (unjust) resolve.
But when they saw the (garden), they said: "We have surely lost our way:
"Indeed we are shut out (of the fruits of our labour)!"

ayas.arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
ayas.translation: Said one of them, more just (than the rest): "Did I not say to you, 'Why not glorify (Allah)?'"
ayas.transliteration: qāla awsaṭuhum alam aqul lakum lawlā tusabbiḥūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"
ayas.transliteration: qālū subḥāna rabbinā innā kunnā ẓālimīn

ayas.translation: Then they turned, one against another, in reproach.
They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!

ayas.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
ayas.translation: "It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this: for we do turn to Him (in repentance)!"
ayas.transliteration: `asā rabbunā an yubdilanā khayran minhā innā ilā rabbinā rāghibūn

ayas.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Such is the Punishment (in this life); but greater is the Punishment in the Hereafter,- if only they knew!
ayas.transliteration: kadhālikal `adhāb ۖ wala`adhābul-ākhirati akbar ۚ law kānū ya`lamūn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
ayas.translation: Verily, for the Righteous, are Gardens of Delight, in the Presence of their Lord.
Shall We then treat the People of Faith like the People of Sin?
What is the matter with you? How judge ye?
Or have ye a book through which ye learn-
That ye shall have, through it whatever ye choose?

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
ayas.translation: Or have ye Covenants with Us to oath, reaching to the Day of Judgment, (providing) that ye shall have whatever ye shall demand?
ayas.transliteration: am lakum aymānun `alaynā bālighatun ilā yawmil qiyāmati inna lakum lamā taḥkumūn

ayas.translation: Ask thou of them, which of them will stand surety for that!

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: Or have they some "Partners" (in Allahhead)? Then let them produce their "partners", if they are truthful!
ayas.transliteration: am lahum shurakā-u falya-tū bishurakā-ihim in kānū ṣādiqīn

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
ayas.translation: The Day that the shin shall be laid bare, and they shall be summoned to bow in adoration, but they shall not be able,-
ayas.transliteration: yawma yukshafu `an sāqin wayud`awna ilas sujūdi falā yastaṭī`ūn

ayas.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Their eyes will be cast down,- ignominy will cover them; seeing that they had been summoned aforetime to bow in adoration, while they were whole, (and had refused).
ayas.transliteration: khāshi`atan abṣāruhum tarhaquhum dhillah ۖ waqad kānū yud`awna ilas sujūdi wahum sālimūn

ayas.arabic: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Then leave Me alone with such as reject this Message: by degrees shall We punish them from directions they perceive not.
ayas.transliteration: fadharnī wa man yukadhhibu bihādhal ḥadīth ۖ sanastadrijuhum min ḥaythu lā ya`lamūn

ayas.translation: A (long) respite will I grant them: truly powerful is My Plan.

ayas.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
ayas.translation: Or is it that thou dost ask them for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-
ayas.transliteration: am tas-aluhum ajran fahum min maghramin muthqalūn

ayas.translation: Or that the Unseen is in their hands, so that they can write it down?

ayas.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
ayas.translation: So wait with patience for the Command of thy Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish,- when he cried out in agony.
ayas.transliteration: faṣbir liḥukmi rabbika walā takun kaṣāḥibil ḥūti idh nādā wahuwa makẓūm

ayas.arabic: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
ayas.translation: Had not Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been cast off on the naked shore, in disgrace.
ayas.transliteration: lawlā an tadārakahu ni`matun min rabbihi lanubidha bil `arā-i wahuwa madhmūm

ayas.translation: Thus did his Lord choose him and make him of the Company of the Righteous.

ayas.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
ayas.translation: And the Unbelievers would almost trip thee up with their eyes when they hear the Message; and they say: "Surely he is possessed!"
ayas.transliteration: wa in yakādul ladhīna kafarū layuzliqūnaka bi-abṣārihim lammā sami`udh dhikra wayaqūlūna innahu lamajnūn

ayas.translation: But it is nothing less than a Message to all the worlds.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā huwa illā dhikrul lil`ālamīn
